member.name: T:CommonCode.MSALClient.AzureAdConfig
member.summary: App settings, populated from appsettings.json file

member.name: P:CommonCode.MSALClient.AzureAdConfig.Authority
member.summary: Gets or sets the Azure AD authority.
member.remarks: - For Work or School account in your org, use your tenant ID, or domain - for any Work or School accounts, use organizations - for any Work or School accounts, or Microsoft personal account, use common - for Microsoft Personal account, use consumers

member.name: P:CommonCode.MSALClient.AzureAdConfig.Instance
member.summary: Gets or sets the login instance for your CIAM tenant. In CIAM usually of the form https://YOUR_DOMAIN.b2clogin.com
member.value: The login instance for your CIAM tenant

member.name: P:CommonCode.MSALClient.AzureAdConfig.ClientId
member.summary: Gets or sets the client Id (App Id) from the app registration in the Azure AD portal.

member.name: P:CommonCode.MSALClient.AzureAdConfig.TenantId
member.summary: Gets or sets the tenant identifier (tenant Id/directory id) of the Azure AD tenant where the app registration exists.

member.name: P:CommonCode.MSALClient.AzureAdConfig.CacheFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the file name of the token cache file.
member.value: The name of the cache file.

member.name: P:CommonCode.MSALClient.AzureAdConfig.CacheDir
member.summary: Gets or sets the token cache file dir.

member.summary: Gets or sets the android redirect URI.

member.summary: Gets or sets the iOS redirect URI.

member.summary: Gets or sets the scopes for MS graph call.

member.name: P:CommonCode.MSALClient.DownStreamApiConfig.ScopesArray
member.summary: Gets the scopes in a format as expected by the various MSAL SDK methods.

member.typeparam: The type of the exception to throw/work with.

member.summary: Throws and exception of the requested type, if the predicate is true
member.param: The predicate to evaluate.
The message to pass to the raised exception.

member.summary: As for the Tenant, you can use a name as obtained from the azure portal, e.g. kko365.onmicrosoft.com"

member.summary: Gets the authentication result (if available) from MSAL's various operations.

member.summary: Gets the MSAL public client application instance.

member.name: P:CommonCode.MSALClient.MSALClientHelper.UseEmbedded
member.summary: This will determine if the Interactive Authentication should be Embedded or System view

member.summary: The PublicClientApplication builder used internally

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes the MSAL's PublicClientApplication builder from config.

member.name: M:CommonCode.MSALClient.MSALClientHelper.InitializePublicClientAppAsync
member.summary: Initializes the public client application of MSAL.NET with the required information to correctly authenticate the user.

member.name: M:CommonCode.MSALClient.MSALClientHelper.AttachTokenCache
member.summary: Attaches the token cache to the Public Client app.
member.returns: IAccount list of already signed-in users (if available)

member.name: M:CommonCode.MSALClient.MSALClientHelper.SignInUserAndAcquireAccessToken(System.String[])
member.summary: Signs in the user and obtains an Access token for a provided set of scopes

member.name: M:CommonCode.MSALClient.MSALClientHelper.SignInUserAndAcquireAccessToken(System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Signs the in user and acquire access token for a provided set of scopes.
member.param: The scopes.
The extra claims, usually from CAE. We basically handle CAE by sending the user back to Azure AD for additional processing and requesting a new access token for Graph

member.name: M:CommonCode.MSALClient.MSALClientHelper.SignInUserInteractivelyAsync(System.String[],Microsoft.Identity.Client.IAccount)
member.summary: Shows a pattern to sign-in a user interactively in applications that are input constrained and would need to fall-back on device code flow.
member.param: The scopes.
The existing account.

member.name: M:CommonCode.MSALClient.MSALClientHelper.SignOutUserAsync
member.summary: Removes the first signed-in user's record from token cache

member.name: M:CommonCode.MSALClient.MSALClientHelper.SignOutUserAsync(Microsoft.Identity.Client.IAccount)
member.summary: Removes a given user's record from token cache
member.param: The user.

member.name: M:CommonCode.MSALClient.MSALClientHelper.FetchSignedInUserFromCache
member.summary: Fetches the signed in user from MSAL's token cache (if available).

member.summary: Gets the application configuration.

member.summary: Gets the instance of DownstreamApiHelper.

member.name: M:CommonCode.MSALClient.PublicClientSingleton.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Private constructor to ensure singleton pattern and force initialization via Initialize method.
member.param: The stream containing the application settings.

member.name: P:CommonCode.MSALClient.PublicClientSingleton.Instance
member.summary: Gets the initialized instance of the PublicClientSingleton. Throws an InvalidOperationException if Initialize has not been called.

member.name: M:CommonCode.MSALClient.PublicClientSingleton.Initialize(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Initializes the PublicClientSingleton with the application settings stream. This method should be called once during application startup.
member.param: The stream for 'appsettings.json'.

member.summary: Acquire the token silently

member.summary: Perform the interactive acquisition of the token for the given scope

member.summary: Retrieves the owned root window by walking the chain of parent and owner windows returned by GetParent.

member.name: M:CommonCode.MSALClient.WindowsHelper.GetAncestor(System.IntPtr,CommonCode.MSALClient.WindowsHelper.GetAncestorFlags)
member.summary: Retrieves the handle to the ancestor of the specified window.
member.param: A handle to the window whose ancestor is to be retrieved. If this parameter is the desktop window, the function returns NULL.
The ancestor to be retrieved.
member.returns: The return value is the handle to the ancestor window.

member.summary: Gets the console or terminal window handle.
